title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Check Stripes", 1968–69
medium: Graphite, charcoal pencil and felt tip marker on heavy tracing paper
inscribed: In charcoal pencil upper right corner" "Roller Print / 48" w x 15 repeat"; Verso: in marker center right:"ROLLER PRINT"
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: A pattern of twenty eight vertical columns with zig-zag linear horizontal pattern. This pattern was used for an Environmental Enrichment panel intended for public spaces such a doctor's offices, cafeterias and office building employee areas.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Check Stripes", 1968–69.Graphite, charcoal pencil and felt tip marker on heavy tracing paper. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-418.
